intro: Psychotria cornuta subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western horned psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly elongated, horn-like structures on its stems, which give it its common name.
